sentence.Network_en: Some battles you win, some battles you lose.
No matter where you go in life or how old you get, there's always something new to learn about. After all, life is full of surprises.
sentence.Network_cn: 不管你生活在哪里，你有多少岁，总有新东西要学习，毕竟，生活总是充满惊喜。

sentence.Network_en: If you wait, all that happens is that you get older.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果你等待，发生的只有变老。

lj.lj_ly: the minister was later to be sacked by you-know-who.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ēow, accusative and dative of gē (see ye), of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch u and German euch. During the 14th cent. you began to replace ye, thou, and thee; by the 17th cent. it had become the ordinary second person pronoun for any number and case

encyclopedia.content: 唱片《You》（中译名：别样的你），是日本著名流行歌手木村kaela正式出道后的第4张单曲作品。2006年1月18日由哥伦比亚唱片公司出版发售。唱片介绍基本信息 唱片名称：You（单曲唱片） 演唱歌手：木村Kaela 音乐风格：J-POP 出版日期：2006年1月18日 版权公司：哥伦比亚唱片公司 排名销量： * 单周榜单最高第7位（ORICON） 单曲年表： 上一张：BEAT（2005） 下一张：happiness!!!（2006年）相关概括 ☆单曲<You>PV的背景伴奏

entry.tran: 你,您,你们（可用于名词前指定谈话对象）
entry.def: A speaker or writer uses you to refer to the person or people that they are talking or writing to. It is possible to use you before a noun to make it clear which group of people you are talking to.

example.ex: When I saw you across the room I knew I'd met you before...
example.tran: 看到你穿过房间时，我就知道我以前曾经见过你。

example.ex: You two seem very different to me...
example.tran: 你们两个似乎与我大不一样。

entry.tran: （用于口语和非正式书面语中表示泛指）你，任何人
entry.def: In spoken English and informal written English, you is sometimes used to refer to people in general.

example.ex: Getting good results gives you confidence...
example.tran: 取得好的结果会给人以信心。

example.ex: In those days you did what you were told.
example.tran: 那时候，你只能听命于人。

entry.tran: （某些方言中指两个或多个人时有时用yous代替you）你们
entry.def: In some dialects of English, yous is sometimes used instead of 'you' when talking to two or more people.

example.ex: 'Yous two are no 'gettin' paid,' he said. 'Ye're too lazy!'
example.tran: “你们两个别指望拿到工钱，”他说。“你们太懒了！”

slang.tokens: Do you eat with that mouth? (=You eat with that mouth?)

list.explanation: (指说下流话、脏话)你说得出口？

example.en: That's a lot of foul talk. Do you eat with that mouth?
example.zh: 那么一大堆下流话。你竟说得出口？

example.en: You talk dirt a lot. You eat with that mouth?
example.zh: 你脏话连篇。你说得出口?

example.en: A: Can I? B: You betcha!
example.zh: 甲:我行吗? 乙:肯定行!

list.explanation: 情况就同我向你说的一样。瞧，我不是说对了吗？

example.en: There you go，the prices went up again!
example.zh: 瞧，不出所料，价格又涨上去了!

list.explanation: 你又在这样干了。你还是老一套

example.en: I just told you not to put that junk on the table and there you go.
example.zh: 我才对你说过，别把那种破烂东叫放在桌上,而你又放了。

Sentence.sentence: For many families the recession means more than not booking a holiday A You Gov poll of 2, 000 people found 22% said they were arguing more with their partners because of concerns about money.
The You Gov poll of 2, 000 people indicates that in a recession it is more expensive for couples to split up
K) "The greatest strength you bring to this essay," says the College Board's how-to book, "is 17 years or so of familiarity with the topic: YOU.
The form and style are very familiar, and best of all, you are the world-class expert on the subject of YOU

Even if the question is ostensibly (表面上) about something outside the self (describe a fictional character or solve a problem of geopolitics), the essay invariably returns to the favorite topic: what is its impact on YOU?

sentences.en: Can you tell me the nearest way to the station?
sentences.cn: 你能告诉我去火车站最近的路吗?

sentences.en: It was absurd of you to do such a thing.
sentences.cn: 你做那样的事是愚蠢的。

sentences.en: You girls are always getting into trouble.
sentences.cn: 你们这些女孩子老是惹麻烦。

sentences.en: Driving on the left is strange at first but you get used to it.
sentences.cn: 沿着路的左侧驾车刚开始时有些别扭, 可是习惯就好了。
